event.title: thousands of years before the arrival of European-American settlers, the Atfalati tribe of the Kalapuya lived

data.event: For thousands of years before the arrival of European-American settlers, the Atfalati tribe of the Kalapuya lived in the Tualatin Valley near the later site of Hillsboro.
Settlers founded a community here in 1842, later named after David Hill, an Oregon politician.

event.title: reached the area in the early 1870s and an interurban electric railway about four decades later

data.event: A railroad reached the area in the early 1870s and an interurban electric railway about four decades later.

event.title: aided the slow growth of the city to about 2,000 people by 1910

data.event: These railways, as well as highways, aided the slow growth of the city to about 2,000 people by 1910 and about 5,000 by 1950, before the arrival of high-tech companies in the 1980s.
